applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to the document for several reasons: 1) The document is a pension life cover scheme rules document that outlines the structure, operation and benefits of a company pension scheme. It does not contain any provisions or policies regarding gifts or rewards. 2) The document focuses on defining trustee duties, scheme benefits, and administrative procedures rather than conduct rules around gifts/rewards. 3) While AIB Life is mentioned as the life office and registered administrator, the document does not address their employee conduct policies or gift-giving practices. 4) The document's scope is limited to the technical and legal framework of operating the pension scheme, not the business conduct standards of the regulated entities involved. The regulation in question specifically deals with preventing conflicts of interest from gifts/rewards between regulated entities and consumers, which is outside the scope of this scheme rules document.
regulation_title: Offering, giving, accepting (etc.) gifts or rewards not to create conflict of interest
regulation_text: 29. Subject to Regulation 23, a regulated entity shall take reasonable steps to ensure that it or any of its officers or employees do not offer, give, solicit or accept any gifts or rewards, monetary or otherwise, likely to conflict with any duty of the regula ted entity towards consumers or any duty of the recipient officer or employee towards consumers in relation to his or her activities in the regulated entity.
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
